content: rounds of stocking stitch for 20 rounds of either of the following - row 1 - s1 purl to the end of the row turn your work lace option row 2 - s1 k1 repeat to the end of the row turn your round 1 - k2 yo s1knit-wise k1 psso to end of work round rounds 2 to 4 - knit all stitches repeat the above 2 row a total of 8 times 16 row knitted textured option round 1 - k3 p1 to end of round round 2 - p1 k1 p2 to end of round a bookmark for dobby this pattern is for personal use only - s1 k4 ssk turn your work slip stitches will make it easy for you to see these stitches along the edge pick up 2 extra stitches in the gap to avoid any holes row 3 - s1 p4 p2tog turn your work you can just pick up 1 extra stitch if you prefer but i find by picking up 2 stitches you get a much neater finish there is a row 4 - s1 k4 ssk turn your work video tutorial in my drippity drop pattern that shows you how i do this place a stitch marker at this point repeat row 3 and 4 until you have used up all your stitches that are on either side of the centre heel stitches you will now knit across needle 1 knit in pattern if using you will be left with 6 stitches on your needle one when you reach the halfway point of this row you need to push those stitches onto needle 2 you now have just 8 stitches on needle 1 place a second stitch marker before picking up 2 stitches to close the gap as previously and then pick up 8 stitches along the other side of the heel flap now using the same needle knit 3 stitches from the heel turn the start of your round is now at the centre of the heel gusset decrease set up round when working this first round knit the picked up gusset stitches through the back loop knit the 4 extra gap closing stitches in the usual manner knit to first marker slip marker and knit to second marker or knit in pattern if using one slip marker and knit to end of round you are now ready to begin the gusset decreases a bookmark for dobby this pattern is for personal use only -
